dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Oh, my God! So sorry.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: It's fine, don’t worry about it. (to bartender) Can I have a tissue, please? Oliver swoops in offering a napkin.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Oh, go, go. Get changed. I/’11 keep Rachel company. Nick smiles to see him.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Thanks you, Oli. (to Rachel) You're in good hands. Give me two minutes. I’11 change.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: It’s okay. Nick takes off -- Rachel extends her hand to Oliver --

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Hi, I’m Rachel. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Oh, I know. Peik Lin scampers up.

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: Rachel!

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Oh, I --

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: Rachel! I heard you thought Ah Ma was the cook! Rachel cringes and covers her face in embarrassment.

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: Ah!

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: (off Rachel) Uh, on the bright side, you’re the talk of the party. People like your dress. Peik Lin and Oliver take each other in. It’s instant fashion chemistry.

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: Oh, I did that.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Oh!

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: I know!

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Such a chic seventies goddess.

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: It's very disco Cleopatra, but in a good way.

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: That’s exactly what I was going for.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Oh, well. Oliver. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: I like your shoes.

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: Oh, thank you. I’m Peik Lin. Ditto.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Cheers.

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: There you go. Rachel looks on, amazed Peik Lin’s already made a friend.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: (re: her earrings) Gosh, these are lovely.

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: They’re clip-ons. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Are they? Oh, wow!

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: So, Oliver, are you a cousin, too?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Mm, well, I’m one of the poorer relations. The rainbow sheep of the family. But I make myself useful. Whatever the Youngs want, I procure. Golden koi fish, Huanghuali furniture. A rare Cambodian gong.

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: Mm.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Why would they want to buy a rare Cambodian gong? On cue, A RESONANT GONG sounds and all eyes turn to Alix.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Because they can.  65. INT. TYERSALL PARK - NICK’S OLD ROOM - NIGHT Nick opens a closet, sees a row of meticulously pressed shirts hanging in a row. He smiles, takes one out. Eleanor walks in.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Ah Ma insists all your clothes be washed and pressed every two weeks. Nick sees his mother standing in the doorway. She walks over, takes the shirt from his hands and selects another shirt for him. (Throughout the scene she also quietly caters to Nick -- dusting his jacket, etc.)

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: This one. As Nick takes off his soiled shirt he looks around at his childhood room filled with pictures and mementoes.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Everything is exactly as I left it. Nick moves to a nearby desk and rifles through a drawer.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: (glances over at him) Looking for your cigars? I had them thrown out years ago.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Never could get anything past you, could I? Eleanor smiles while she fiddles with Nick’s clean shirt laying on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: I keep telling Ah Ma to put your things away, but she says this room makes her feel like you’re still here. (then) Well, I got an earful when you didn’t move back last year. Nick reacts, it’s a loaded subject. Eleanor helps Nick put on the clean shirt. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Your father and I are really looking forward to having you home. He’s not getting any younger. With you onboard, maybe he'll take a day off once ina while.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I know, Mum. I’m just not ready yet. There’s things in New York that I wanna see through. It’s not the answer Eleanor was looking for. She presses on another Nick grins front:

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Well, I’m happy I finally met Rachel. She is very impressive.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I think so, too. And I thought you might be excited that the first girl that I bring home is a Chinese professor.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: (noncommittal smile) Chinese-American. (fishes) You know, bringing her home, introducing her at a large family gathering... Some people may say --

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: When there’s something to say about Rachel and me, you’ll be first to hear. (off Eleanor) But some things I need to figure out on my own. as Eleanor helps him put on his jacket. Nick scoffs.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Is that an American accent I’m hearing?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: How do I look? Eleanor adjusts the pocket square in his jacket pocket, regards her son. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guests stream into a vast open-air courtyard. Alix and Felicity hold court as guests admire the large, spidery, white flowers which are STARTING TO BLOOM.

dialogues.speaker: ALIX
dialogues.text: Everyone! Everyone! The tan hua plants very rarely bloom, and even then only at night.

dialogues.speaker: FELICITY
dialogues.text: Their beauty is spectacular, but fleeting. By dawn they’1l be gone.

dialogues.speaker: ALIX
dialogues.text: So... come. Come. The crowd claps. ZOOM IN ON the tan hua plant taking center stage in the conservatory.

dialogues.speaker: IN ANOTHER AREA
dialogues.text: Oliver pretends to admire the flowers as he points out the social scene to Peik Lin and Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Oh! Someone forgot to wear a bra. He gestures to Kitty Pong, who’s entered with Alistair.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Kitty Pong. Cousin Alistair’s latest flame. An actress. Rumor is, she was in a porno. Two Girls, One Cup a Noodles. Kitty bends down to smell a tan hua, her boobs almost spilling out of her dress. The Aunties are horrified.

dialogues.speaker: KITTY
dialogues.text: (kissing one of the guests) Baby!

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: (matter-of-fact) You know, I thought I would like that more than I did. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: The book is much better.

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: Mm-hmm. Rachel is distracted seeing some YOUNG WOMEN sneak cold glances at her.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Is it just me or are people, like, staring at me?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Oh, they’re just jealous. You nabbed the crown prince. (off Rachel) Nicki is Ah Ma’s favorite, in line to inherit everything. No surprise there when that’s the competition. Oliver looks to Eddie checking himself out on his iPhone cam, and Alistair who’s hypnotized by Kitty’s cleavage. Rachel is uncomfortable with the implication.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Oh, speaking of the grande dame... Rachel turns to see guests make way for an elderly lady, Nick’s AH MA (80s). She’s regal, elegant, but frail, leaning on Eleanor to help her walk. She doesn’t say a word, but everyone, her own family included, acts in total deference and respect to her. As Rachel takes it in, feeling a little out of place. Nick appears.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: There you are. I’ve been looking all over for you. You ready to meet my grandmother? As Nick takes her by the hand and leads her through the crow -- They reach Ah Ma who LIGHTS UP to see her favorite grandson. The veneer of decorum drops as she reaches out to him, hugging him and touching his face.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Ah Ma... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: AH MA
dialogues.text: (in Mandarin; subtitled) Guai sunzi, ni huilai la! Zheme duo rizi ye bu huilai kan kan Ah Ma. Hai hao wo hai huozhe. Wi qule na’er? Ni zenme shou le? [Nicki, you're home! Not coming to see your grandma for so long. I’m glad I’m still alive. Did you eat yet? You’ve become too skinny.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (in Mandarin; subtitled) Wo xiangnian nin zhu de cai. [That’s because I miss your cooking.] Ah Ma, zhe shi wo de hao pengyou, Rachel Chu. (Grandma, this is my good friend, Rachel Chu. Rachel steps forward, replies in perfect Mandarin.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (in Mandarin; subtitled) Ah Ma, xiexie nin yaoging wo lai nin de jia. Nick jingchang tigi nin. Ta shuo nin bao de shuijiao shi quan shijie zui hao chi de. (Grandma, thank you for inviting me to your home. Nick always talks about you. He says no one in the world makes better dumplings. The old lady looks pleased.

dialogues.speaker: AH MA
dialogues.text: (in Mandarin; subtitled) Na mei shenme de. Ni yuanyi wo keyi jiao ni. [It’s nothing. I can show you how to make them, too.]

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (in Mandarin; subtitled) Na shizai tai haole. [I would be honored. J] (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: AH MA
dialogues.text: (in Mandarin; subtitled) Buguo ni yao zao dian huilai. Bie Zai zheme duo ren de difang. [You must come back soon, then, when there are not so many craning necks around...] Ah Ma smiles and nods.

dialogues.speaker: ALIX, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Look, they’re in full bloom. PAN OVER TO the tan hua plant. People clap --

dialogues.speaker: PEOPLE AT PARTY
dialogues.text: Aww... Nick stands up to let Rachel sit next to Ah Ma.

dialogues.speaker: JACQUELINE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It's so nice having Nick back home. But he seems... different.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER PART OF THE COURTYARD
dialogues.text: where Eleanor has been watching with Jacqueline. She sees Nick and Rachel embracing, laughing, KISSING. Looking every bit the couple in love.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: When children are away from home too long, they forget who they are. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A THUMPING CLUB BEAT PLAYS as we PAN DOWN A LINE OF ULTRA LUXURY CARS: fully-customized Lamborghinis, Maseratis, Bugattis.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: What’s up? Let’s jam! More cars pull in as Singapore's JET-SET CROWD piles out and greets each other. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Valets load luggage onto sleek golf carts before transporting them to a PRIVATE JET and THREE MATCHING HELICOPTERS outside the hangar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the middle of the hangar is a SLEEK HELICOPTER surrounded by a circular bar, which divides the bachelors from the bachelorettes. Rachel and Nick enter the hangar as Araminta runs up to them.

dialogues.speaker: ARAMINTA
dialogues.text: Ah! Rachel! So happy you’re here. Oh! Oh, my God. Your Gap look, brilliant.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: ARAMINTA
dialogues.text: She's coming with me.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Ah! Hold on. (to Rachel) Kiss. Thirty-six hours. Bye. (to Araminta) Minty, one piece, please.

dialogues.speaker: ARAMINTA
dialogues.text: Yeah. Yeah. Yeah. Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Not listening at all.

dialogues.speaker: ARAMINTA
dialogues.text: So, I’m gonna intro you to my posse. We're flying to my mom's resort in Sumatra. She’s closed down the whole place just for us. We’re gonna have so much fun. Come on, meet the girls. Araminta drags Rachel over to a group of girls. Rachel gives Nick a last look as Araminta pulls her away:

dialogues.speaker: ARAMINTA
dialogues.text: Girls, this is Rachel Chu.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Hi. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ARAMINTA’S FRIEND

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: ARAMINTA’S NICE FRIEND Nice to meet you. Colin, in rumpled Comme des Garcons, finds Nick. As Bernard makes his way toward them --

dialogues.speaker: EXCITED GUY
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (surprised) So you let Bernard Tai organize all of this?

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Yeah. Bernard.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: This is for you, asshole.

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN PINK JACKET
dialogues.text: Asshole. OFF Nick and Colin, realizing the weekend they’re in for.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER AREA
dialogues.text: Araminta and posse, including Celine and Francesca, drink bellinis served by HOT, SHIRTLESS WAITERS as they admire each others’ hair/boobs/handbags and gossip. Rachel hangs on the outskirts, aware she doesn’t fit in, catching bits of conversation. Rachel and the women turn to see -- -- TWO GORGEOUS WOMEN STEP OUT OF A SPORTS CAR. They're SISTERS.

dialogues.speaker: ARAMINTA
dialogues.text: TINA! TINI! The twins are in the house! Ooh, I’m so glad you made it! How are you? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TINI
dialogues.text: Hi! Araminta and the bachelorettes flock to the sisters, leaving Rachel and another woman, AMANDA (30s). Unlike Araminta’s other friends, Amanda doesn’t look or act like a high-maintenance model.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: (re: Tina and Tini) It's easy to make a killer entrance when you come as a matching set. Hi, we haven't met. I’m Amanda Ling. Rachel laughs.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Hi, I’m Rachel Chu.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: Oh, you’re Nick Young’s friend?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: (off Rachel) Word gets around fast here. You're a professor at NYU, right?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Yes. Um, what, what about you?

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: Oh, I’m a lawyer. General counsel to the Young Family Corporation, actually.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: That's very impressive.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: Mm, nah. Just good old-fashioned nepotism. I grew up with Nick and Colin. We're family friends. (then) It’s nice to meet you, Rachel Chu. Rachel smiles, happy to find a like-minded friend. They hear a BEEP BEEP as Araminta arrives in a golf cart.

dialogues.speaker: ARAMINTA
dialogues.text: Ladies, come on! We’re wheels up in five. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: Let's do this?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: Oh! Fuck! Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Okay! The golf cart takes off as Rachel and Amanda are barely seated and almost drop their drinks.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: Yeah! The cart takes off towards the jet...

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: All I wanted was a weekend away with my boys. And some beer. Maybe some rugby.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Don’t worry. It’s gonna be great, whatever happens.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Let's make some babies!

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Yeah. I don’t think it will be. EXT./INT. SINGAPORE HARBOR/HELICOPTER -— DAY The 3 helicopters fly over the open sea. Wagner’s Ride of the Valkyries plays.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: In one chopper, Bernard brags to Nick and Colin.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: Any asshole can plan a normal stag party. Hookers, drugs, dog- fighting. That’s minor league shit. To organize a party this massive -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (low; to Colin) Takes a massive asshole?

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: Takes a goddamn mastermind. Colin looks out to see nothing but the ocean around them.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Where exactly is this party?

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: It's right there. They all look out the window at a LARGE CARGO SHIP. Colin and Nick exchange looks, WIF? But as they get closer...

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Bloody hell! REVEAL: The containers on the ship have been arranged and modified to create a HUGE PARTY PLAYGROUND. A floating Disneyland for adults. Painted on the side is “BALLIN’ COLIN’S BACHELOR PARTY.” The guys descend on the scene.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: Y-y-yeah! The partiers respond in kind welcoming them to the revelry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a LONG SHOT we see a flare go off into the sky. We hear it enter the sea with a splash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Hello Bitches” by CL POUNDS. STYLISTIC FLASHES as the guys walk past CARGO CONTAINERS THAT HAVE BEEN CONVERTED into a POOL and DANCE FLOOR manned by attractive MODEL WAITRESSES. Some of the women wear beauty pageant-type sashes across their chests: UKRAINE, UNITED KINGDOM, NETHERLANDS. Bernard, standing in front of the beauty queens, is holding a bazooka-like flare gun setting off another flare. He laughs manically. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The other guys are drinking surrounded by girls in bikinis.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Oh, my God, Nick. What are you worried about? You don’t have to keep Rachel happy. She’s just lucky to be here.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Nice, Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Oh, what? So do we pretend like that’s not the truth? Are we in some kinda fairy tale story that I don’t know about? Did you find a shoe at midnight and jump in a pumpkin? Yo, I got so much shit about marrying Fiona and her parents own the biggest shipping company in Hong Kong. (to Colin) Hey, Araminta’s adorable, but you think your dad would be spending millions on this wedding if her parents didn’t own a billion- dollar resort chain? What’s Rachel bringing to the table? Alistair sits with his arms wrapped around two women, one wearing a sash labeled “ISRAEL.”

dialogues.speaker: ALISTAIR
dialogues.text: Oh! Small tits! They all laugh. Nick steps to Alistair, about to hit him, but Colin stands in the way.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Oh...

dialogues.speaker: ALISTAIR
dialogues.text: Oh! Colin stops Nick --

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, hey. It’s not worth it, man. They’re drunk.  77.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER ON STAGE
dialogues.text: lined with bikini-clad women. Bernard yells toward Colin and the guys --

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: Hey, guys, this is boring. Massage time. And you, the bachelor. You gonna get one before this weekend is over. Or we gonna tie you up and shave your coo coo chara. Everyone laughs uproariously as Bernard brandishes the bazooka.

dialogues.speaker: PEOPLE AT BACHELOR PARTY
dialogues.text: (yell) Coo coo chara. Coo coo chara. Coo coo chara. Coo coo chara. Bernard has a missile-type launcher on his shoulder --

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: Shit! Come try this. Nick and Colin start walking away from the party.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: We have to get off this ship.

dialogues.speaker: ARAMINTA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (pre-lap) Welcome to paradise...

dialogues.speaker: ARAMINTA
dialogues.text: This is Samsara Island. SHOT OF the lush island as Araminta addresses the girl --

dialogues.speaker: ARAMINTA
dialogues.text: This weekend is about sisterhood and connecting with the divine in all of us. So, I hope you’ll all find your bliss... starting with... (yelling; psyched) +--+. an all-paid shopping spree at the fashion boutique!! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The women SCREAM with excitement! Araminta Rachel and grabs her hand and drags her off shopping boutique.

dialogues.speaker: ARAMINTA
dialogues.text: Come on! Come on!
runs to toward the

dialogues.speaker: SMASH CUT TO
dialogues.text: It’s CHAOS as women grab and fight over clothes. Francesca and Celine are in a tug-o-war over a caftan.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA
dialogues.text: Bitch, I saw this first!

dialogues.speaker: CELINE
dialogues.text: But you have ping-pong tits!

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA
dialogues.text: Oh, what about your mosquito bites?

dialogues.speaker: CELINE
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA
dialogues.text: You know it’s true!

dialogues.speaker: CELINE
dialogues.text: You’re such a bitch!

dialogues.speaker: ARAMINTA
dialogues.text: One more minute! You keep what you can carry. One more minute. You keep what you can carry. With little time to spare, women FIGHT OVER outfits. Rachel has a new dress she’s just tried on. the carnage, confused. Amanda clocks this.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: Yep, no one loves free stuff more than rich people. (re: dress) Just the one dress for you?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I don’t wanna lose an arm. She watches (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: Ooh. Well, in that case... one last touch. Amanda looks around, picks out a NECKLACE from a display and puts it on Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: Well, isn’t Nick a lucky guy. Rachel looks at herself in the mirror -- Amanda is right -- it’s the perfect accent.

dialogues.speaker: ARAMINTA
dialogues.text: Time’s up!!! Next stop, SPA!

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: Nick and Colin sit on lounge chairs at a GORGEOUS DESERTED BEACH. Colin takes in the view, at peace, and takes a sip of a beer.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: You're a genius. You know that, right?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: What’s a best man for? I guess that pilot’s license came in handy after all. (beat) Here you go, champ.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Oh, thank you, sir. Mmm. I think that is the best beer I’ve ever had.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I’m gonna have to agree with you on that.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: You know, if it wasn’t for Araminta, I’d ask you to marry me.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Although... (reaches into his pocket) .-.. there is a little something that might get in the way of that. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Nick pulls out a jewelry box, opens it displaying a beautiful engagement ring.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Mmm. No!

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Is that real?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Wow! Yes! Yes, man! Congratulations!

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: That is freaking amazing.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I’m ready.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: You're ready. You're doing it! Nick, I’m really happy for you, man.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Thanks, dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN ACROSS Araminta and the women enjoying various spa treatments: hot stone massages, mani-pedis, mud baths... Rachel and Amanda are getting Thai massages. Rachel’s MASSEUSE pushes up her leg, gets uncomfortably close.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (grunts) I think my masseuse just got me pregnant. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: (laughs) I can see why Nick put off coming back to Singapore.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: You know. He was supposed to come back last year, take over the family business. His parents freaked out when he didn’t. But, now that he’s back, I’m sure all is forgiven.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: But he’s not back for good. I mean, we're just here for a wedding. Amanda looks at her, sympathetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ISLAND (MALAYSIA) -— DAY

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Wow!

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: But?

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: No, I’m really happy for you.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Colin, I’ve known you since you were in nappies. I know when there’s something on your mind.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Well, it wasn’t that long ago that you were sure you were moving back home. And I mean, Rachel loves her job in New York.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Yeah, we’re gonna figure that out.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: You're going to figure it out. Right. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (pre-lap) Rachel, I get it.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: It’s hard knowing where you stand with someone like Nicholas Young. He has all that pressure from his family. Not just in business, but in who he’s dating. It’s like, you just never know what’s quite going on in that gorgeous head of his -- Rachel stares at Amanda who realizes she’s overstepped. As Rachel

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: Nick told you that we were together, right? It’s ancient history now. Although our families, particularly his mother, always wanted us to get married. I guess we weren’t ready then. reacts at this revelation:

dialogues.speaker: COLIN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (pre-lap) Dude... ISLAND (MALAYSIA) -— DAY

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: ++. ever since primary school, you were always going to be the next chairman of the Young Corporation, your family's shining heir. You really think your family's going to accept anything less than that? I mean, unless you... No. Are you thinking of walking out? Leaving everything to bloody Alistair and Eddie?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I'm not walking out on anything. I met a girl, I fell in love and I want to marry her. And it can't just be one thing or the other. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Uh, no, no, no, no, no. It's, it's not that simple. You know that.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: I really admire you. Takes guts, coming all the way over here, facing Nick’s family. Especially when Eleanor isn’t exactly in your corner.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Okay. Your family aside, have you ever thought about what your relationship with Rachel will be like if you got married? I mean, okay, you're, you're Nicholas Young, you're untouchable. You always have been. But Rachel's not. And if...

dialogues.speaker: COLIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: +.. she becomes Mrs. Nicholas Young, every day for her is going to be a struggle. Rachel gets up, feels uneasy. Amanda TEXTS: She’s on the move... Hook, line, and SINK HER.

dialogues.speaker: CELINE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I heard she told Tini that Nick is a good catch.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA
dialogues.text: Oh! So typical. She’s not even that pretty. It’s like she’s never heard of plastic surgery.

dialogues.speaker: CELINE
dialogues.text: (chuckling) Oh, shit. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rachel feels sick. After hearing Celine and Francesca, she exits, fleeing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel flees, upset, when she COLLIDES with someone. It's Astrid, who’s just arrived. She clutches a bag while PORTERS behind her carry her luggage.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: You sure she’s ready for that? Nick sighs.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: Rachel? They head to the resort villa suite --

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: It’s okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel enters with Astrid who she’s downloaded to.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: Let’s just forget about those girls. Camp out here and order room service. Astrid looks at Rachel, concerned. Rachel suddenly SCREAMS. On the bed is a LARGE, GUTTED FISH. Its blood and guts all over the white sheets. On one of the windows are words scrawled in red: “CATCH THIS, YOU GOLD-DIGGING BITCH!” (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: I‘1l call security --

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: No. Astrid reacts, surprised. Rachel pulls herself together.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I’m not gonna make a scene. ZOOM IN ON the window and the nasty message --

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I’m not gonna give them the satisfaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drunken bachelorettes dance as a DJ spins tracks.

dialogues.speaker: FURTHER DOWN THE BEACH
dialogues.text: Rachel rants as she and Astrid dig a HOLE in the sand.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: This weekend was supposed to be mani-pedis, cocktails served in pineapples. This definitely wasn’t on the menu -- Rachel dumps the wrapped fish in the hole.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Why would Araminta even have friends like them? They're so mean. As Rachel fills the hole:

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: Well, you grow up your whole lives together, you make excuses for people. Specially the morons.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I mean, I know Michael didn’t have to deal with catty, fish-killing sociopaths, but how did you two get through all this? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Astrid wan recognizes Astrid man Rachel nod shoulder, crash into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick enter: 86.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: Well, I didn't have it quite this bad, but it wasn't pretty.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Well, at least tell me it gets better.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: Of course it does. tts to reassure Rachel, but she can’t. Rachel that something is wrong.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: Yeah... (beat; close to tears) Actually... no...

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You could talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: (tough to say) Michael is... having an affair.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I’m really sorry, Astrid. ages a smile, appreciates it. s. Astrid smiles, puts her head on Rachel’s hold each other’s hands, and watch the waves the shore.

dialogues.speaker: ES HOTEL
dialogues.text: s the hotel --

dialogues.speaker: MALE HOTEL GREETER
dialogues.text: Welcome back.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Cheers, sir.  87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick enters the hotel having returned from his trip. He sees Rachel reading in a quiet area. He heads over, throws his bag down.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I thought I was here to meet your family...

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: ++. go to your best friend's wedding, eat some good food. Instead, I feel like I'm a villain in a soap opera who's plotting to steal your family fortune. Nick blanches. Knows this isn’t good.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I mean, I met Amanda. She told me that everyone here thinks that I'm the evil person that prevented you from moving back to Singapore last year but, when I didn't even know you were supposed to come home.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: You have every reason to be upset -

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I’m not done yet! There was also the gutted, bloody fish that Araminta’s friends left for me in my hotel room on my bed next to the words ‘Catch this, you gold- digging bitch’... written in big fat serial-killer letters --

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Is that all that happened? (off Rachel) I mean, please tell me that’s all that happened. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick takes Nick takes 88.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You know what? I don't even care about those stupid girls, with their stupid little designer handbags and sunglasses. I don't care about that. I don't care that your ex-girlfriend told me all this crap. It's that you didn't tell me any of it.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I screwed up.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I really messed up, okay?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Why? What -- Were you trying to test me? Why would you do that? a beat, comes clean.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I made a mistake. When we first met, you had no idea who I was, who my family were. You didn't care!

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Yeah, I don't care about that stupid stuff.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Well, exactly. You are so different from all of the women that I grew up with. And I love who I am around you. And I don't want that to change. And that's selfish, I know. her hand.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Mm-hmm.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: And I'm sorry that you had to deal with that on your own. But I'm here now. And whatever happens, we'll get through it together. Dead fish and all. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As Rachel scoffs --

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: All right?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: It was so gross. But I buried it.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: You dealt with it. They laugh. He holds her. Rachel is touched.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Come here.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You know what? We need to do something tonight. We need to do something that's just you and me, okay?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: 100% agree.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: But... we do have to go make some dumplings first. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Then can we eat them?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: We can eat as many as you like.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Okay, fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUICK CUTS of food being expertly prepared by half a dozen MAIDS: -- Small balls of dough are rolled into flat circles. -- Minced meat is quickly rolled into dozens of perfectly formed, uniform BALLS. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A maid takes a tray of the mincemeat balls to the center of the room, where Eleanor and other family members -- Nick, Rachel, Astrid, Cassian, Oliver, Alix, and Felicity -- are clustered around a large table. They’re busy folding the dumplings, which are placed in neatly-stacked bamboo steamers. It’s a family tradition, and they work expertly while having multiple conversations.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I can’t believe this is your first time making dumplings. Rachel laughs.

dialogues.speaker: ALIX
dialogues.text: Gotta make sure this time we don’t run out of baskets.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: Cassian, that’s not how you do it. (beat) Very good. Very good, Cassian. Cassian laughs.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: And now you roll it up. As Eleanor inspects the tray and nods her approval, Felicity eyes DOZENS of waiting trays with alarm.

dialogues.speaker: ALIX
dialogues.text: This is too much. We're hosting a rehearsal dinner, not feeding an army --

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Better too many than have people say we're stingy. Meanwhile, Nick teaches Rachel how to fold a dumpling -- putting the mincemeat ball in the dough wrapper and sealing it closed.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: So, right. You put the baby in bed and tuck, tuck, tuck. Same on the other side. And you give him a kiss goodnight --

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Okay. That’s so cute. And then you eat the baby. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: How's that? (chuckles) Then you eat the baby. Not until he's cooked.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: No, you gotta make sure he’s cooked. Did Ah Ma teach you that?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: She did.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: I, on the other hand, was taught by Grand Aunty Mabel. ‘You put the Botox in the face and then you pinch, pinch, pinch, then voila!’

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Did you guys all learn when you were kids?

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: We didn’t have a choice. Nods to Cassian as he happily pounds balls of dough with his fist and rips apart dumplings.

dialogues.speaker: FELICITY
dialogues.text: We taught you so you’d know the blood, sweat, and tears it took to raise and feed you monkeys.

dialogues.speaker: ALIX
dialogues.text: Not like ang-mohs, microwaving macaroni and cheese for their own children. (shudders ) No wonder they put their parents in the old folks’ home when they all grow up.

dialogues.speaker: FELICITY
dialogues.text: I know!

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Ah Ma says if we don’t pass traditions down like this, they’1l disappear. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: (to Rachel) God forbid we lose the ancient Chinese tradition of guilting your children. The others all laugh --

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: It’s totally worth it. Mother used to wait for me after school with a nice basket of these.

dialogues.speaker: ALIX
dialogues.text: (in Cantonese; subtitled) Ni hao ming. [Lucky you.] Eleanor smiles at the memory.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: (to Felicity) Hey, I never got after-school dumplings.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Well, that’s because Aunty Felicity was doing after-school microdermabrasion.

dialogues.speaker: FELICITY
dialogues.text: (mock-scolds; in Cantonese; subtitled) Ni le wu gie, ruguo a ye zhong xi du, shi ging ni shi teng tiao wen zhurou. [Smart ass. If your grandfather was alive, he'd kick you into next week. ] Everyone LAUGHS. Alix sees Rachel smiling. Felicity throws dough at Oliver.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: (brushing shirt) Aunty, this is Dolce.

dialogues.speaker: ALIX
dialogues.text: (to Rachel) You speak Cantonese?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: No, I don’t. It’s just great seeing you guys all like this. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The family exchanges looks. What does Rachel mean?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: When I was growing up, it was just me and my mom. Which I loved, uh, but we didn’t really have a big family like this. It’s really nice.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: That's so lovely of you to say, Rachel. We all are very lucky to have each other. Alix and Felicity smile, approving. Feeling more comfortable, Rachel tries to engage Eleanor, who’s been largely silent. She sees Eleanor’s RING, a beautiful piece studded with diamonds and emeralds.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: That’s a beautiful ring, Aunty Eleanor. I’ve never seen anything like it. The other women look at Eleanor, trying to gauge her reaction to Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: (surprised; then) Nick’s father had it made when he proposed to me.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: That's very romantic. How did you guys meet?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Actually, they met at Cambridge. They were both studying law together.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Oh, I didn’t know you were a lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: I wasn’t. I withdrew from university when we got married.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Oh... Eleanor reads into Rachel’s reaction. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: I chose to help my husband run a business and to raise a family. For me, it was a privilege. But for you, you may think it's old- fashioned. It's nice you appreciate this house and us being here together wrapping dumplings. But all this doesn't just happen. It's because we know to put family first, instead of chasing one's passion. An awkward SILENCE falls over the table. Rachel feels chided, isn’t sure how to react when:

dialogues.speaker: AH MA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (in Mandarin; subtitled) O, nimen dajia douzai zhe’er a! [Ah, everyone’s here! ] Ah Ma enters with her Thai maids. Oblivious to the tension, she smiles to see Nick and Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Ah Ma.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: Ah Ma.

dialogues.speaker: ALIX
dialogues.text: Ah Ma.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (to maids) Thank you. (takes his grandma's arm) Ah Ma.

dialogues.speaker: AH MA
dialogues.text: Oh, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Come and sit.

dialogues.speaker: AH MA
dialogues.text: (in Mandarin; subtitled) O, Nicki. O, ni ba Rachel ye dailai le? [Oh, Nicki. You brought Rachel. Good. ] Ah Ma looks at Rachel’s face, scrutinizing it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: AH MA
dialogues.text: Baitian wo kan ni kan de geng qingchu le. Ni de bizi zhang de henhao, hen you fuqi. Wo kan kan ni de lian. Guolai. [I can see you more clearly in the day. The shape of your nose is auspicious. Let me have a look, come closer... (leans in) En... en... zhang de zhen haokan. Qingchu le. [Very nice looking. ] Rachel is unsure what to make of it, but it feels like approval.

dialogues.speaker: AH MA
dialogues.text: (in Mandarin; subtitled) Sit, sit, grandson.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Right, right. We're almost done here. Just a few more baskets. Ah Ma looks at the dumplings.

dialogues.speaker: AH MA
dialogues.text: (to Eleanor; in Mandarin; subtitled) Aiyo, zheshi ni bao de jiaozi ma? Zenme bao name nankan a? Tuibule. [You made those dumplings? They don’t look very good. You lost your touch. ] Astrid watches this exchange, then looks at Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Hmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel exits the dining room, looking for anywhere to go. She walks up the long staircase, takes a few steps one way, realizes she’s going the wrong direction, then turns around to find Eleanor standing in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (surprised) Oh. Hi. I think I'ma little lost. This house is pretty big. Eleanor comes to Rachel and they walk and talk through the halls of Tyersall. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel is 96.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: I’m glad I found you. I’m afraid that I’ve been unfair.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Oh, no, you know what? I'm sorry I made an assumption. I didn't mean to offend you.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Not at all. (then) You asked about my ring. The truth is Nick’s father had it made when he wanted to propose to me, because Ah Ma wouldn’t give him the family ring. I wasn’t her first choice. Honestly, I wasn’t her second.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Gosh, I'm so sorry. I had no idea.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: I didn’t come from the right family, have the right connections. And Ah Ma thought I would not make an adequate wife to her son. surprised how Eleanor is seemingly opening up.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: But, she came around, obviously. Eleanor gives a tight smile.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: It took many years, and she had good reason to be concerned. (off Rachel) Because I had no idea the work and the sacrifice it would take. There were many days when I wondered if I would ever measure up -- Eleanor pauses, looks at Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: But having been through it all, I know this much... (gets close; gently) You will never be enough. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rachel is eviscerated. Eleanor draws back, placid, calm. Then, as if they’ve been talking about the weather Eleanor walks off:

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: We should head back. I wouldn’t want Nick to worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick drives as Rachel sits in the passenger seat, silent.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: You all right?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I know my mum can be tough at times, but there isn’t anything she wouldn’t do for me... (off Rachel’s silence) And there is a reason why I lived with Ah Ma growing up. It’s because my mother knew she wasn’t the favorite. So she let her raise me so I would be.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You were just a kid?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Yeah. But... It's hard to understand from the outside. But she did what she thought was best for the family... For everyone involved. Rachel hears the tiny reminder of her otherness.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Mm-hmm. Rachel takes it in, hears Nick’s regard for his mother. Which makes her feel even more unsettled.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Anyway, I think I've had enough with dumplings for the rest of my life. What should we do? Sushi, movies, anything you like. Really.  98.

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Wait, what? Was she like -- TILT DOWN -- Peik Lin and Rachel sit at a table.

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: (Eleanor impression) “You will NEVER be good enough for my son,’ OR was it like, ‘YOU, YOU will never be good enough for my son.’

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: It’s like the second one.

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Except for in a way that made me wanna, like, cry and puke at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: God, she’s so badass. (idea) You know, I bet if you told her you'd leave Nick for a million dollars, she will write that check. They do that around here --

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: -- And she looked at me like I was nothing...

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: -- Like a ten million dollar check. I feel like she would do that.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I don't even know what I should do. I mean, I can't even tell Nick because he like worships her.

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: Yeah, Chinese sons think their moms fart Chanel No. 5. What about the Ah Ma? Does she hate your face, too? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Okay, nobody said they hated my face. And Ah Ma, she liked my face. She said I had a lucky nose.

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: That’s great! You know, Eleanor can hate you all day long, but you can’t beat two thousand years of Chinese filial piety.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I feel like I shouldn't even go to the wedding. You know, it's Colin and Araminta's day, I don't wanna cause any drama there. I feel like I should just sit it out. You know? Tell Nick I had food poisoning or something. (off Peik Lin’s look) What?

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: That’s bullshit. You’re just scared.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: No, I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: Okay, here's what you need to understand, all right? It's not about getting Eleanor to like you. It's about getting her to respect you. All right? Right now, she just thinks you're some like undeserving, clueless, gold- digging --

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Okay, yeah, I got it.

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: -- trashy, unrefined banana, yellow on the outside, white on the inside --

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I know what a banana is --

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: -- When in reality, you’re like a super sophisticated, smart professor of freaking game theory. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This hits 100.

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Show her that side of you, you know. home with Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You're right.

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: Damn straight, I’m right. It’s Peik Lin, I’m always right.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Yeah, she's like trying to play a game of chicken with me, where she's like coming at me, and like, thinking I'm going to swerve like a chicken.

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: But you can't swerve.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna swerve. Not for her.

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: No. Chickens are bitches, dude!

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: And I'm not a chicken

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: You're not a chicken. You gonna roll up to that wedding, you gonna be like, ‘Bak-bak, bitch!’

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (chuckles) Bak-bak, bitch!

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: Chickens are bitches. A man on one of the upper balconies overhears her, gives her a disapproving look.

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: Sorry Uncle.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What are you doing tonight? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: Uh, I was gonna go to FedEx or something. Why? Oh! Peik Lin breaks into a smile. OFF Rachel, determined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: standing in front of a tall tri-fold mirror as Peik Lin scrutinizes her.

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: I have been waiting to do this properly for so long. I'm thinking eyebrow triage, root crimps, maybe some eyelid tape. (to Oliver) What do you think? REVEAL OLIVER standing off to the side with his entourage.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: All of it. And I would throw ina Korean snail face mask. Sweetie, your skin is so dry, it's hurting my face.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Thank you. As Oliver walks around her, scrutinizing.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: You know, it’s about time someone stood up to Aunty Eleanor. Well, you, not me. Oh, God! She can’t know I was ever here.

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Oh, no

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: (yelling to the air) Right. Well, okay, let’s get to work. Cappuccinos.  102.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long line of stately cars lead to the entrance. Throngs have gathered hoping to catch sight of arriving celebrities. It’s a mix of FOREIGN DIGNITARIES, GOVERNMENT LEADERS, and Asia’s brightest stars. QUICK CUTS of reporters and photographers continues throughout the following scene.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Pull the plum Balenciaga, the peach Chloé, the Giambattista, all the Bottegas, oh, and that Jason Wu with the deconstructed ruffles.

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: And a sandwich for Peik Lin. Rachel enters modeling different dresses.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Oh!

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: Okay. All right.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Right. I'm not sure if it's working or if she looks like a clown's tampon.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Oh!

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: On a heavy day.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: (next dress) Y-You look like a flower. Like a sad, lonely flower no one wants to be around.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: (to Reporter) I mean, it's the wedding of the century. So, of course we're here. It's the natural...

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Oh! Oh! It’s not that bad. It’s holding you up.

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: It’s a hands-on dress. You know what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: WYE MUN
dialogues.text: (throws dress over partition) Incoming. Peik Lin points for him to leave.

dialogues.speaker: WYE MUN
dialogues.text: Okay. Okay

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: And this fantastic celebration here with -- Francesca and Celine pose for the cameras. Alistair poses with Kitty Pong, who’s delighted by all the attention.

dialogues.speaker: KITTY
dialogues.text: I love my fans... I love my fans.

dialogues.speaker: ALISTAIR
dialogues.text: (to reporters) Taipei Tiger Two is going to redefine the genre. She's a star.

dialogues.speaker: KITTY
dialogues.text: TT-Two, honey!

dialogues.speaker: ALISTAIR
dialogues.text: She's a star.  104.

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: Oh! I'm blinded by the light.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Oh. Okay. This is why disco died.

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: You kinda look like a slutty Ebola virus.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: It's like a bag of Skittles. Taste the rainbow.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Could work, if we... Yes. I, I think we just alter the -- Wye Mun comes back in offering another outfit --

dialogues.speaker: WYE MUN
dialogues.text: (whispering) I, I, just think if we could just maybe just tell her this is coming from you because she probably doesn't wanna hear it from a guy. Okay. Okay. Peik Lin throws him out again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie, Fiona, and their three boys, again in adorable matching suits, pose for photographers. Eddie nudges his eldest son.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Okay, remember. Optimal angles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver and Neenah are accessorizing the sparkly disco- type dress Rachel is now wearing. When Rachel goes behind the partition to change her outfit, Neenah, Wye Mun, P.T., and the twins all start dancing to the music. Peik Lin’s parents get carried away and start making out on the chaise lounge.  105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie trails off as the photographers suddenly head to -- -- a custom GOLD BENTLEY MULSANE. It’s driven by Peik Lin, who wears a fetching driver's uniform. Seeing the car, Oliver steps up as Peik Lin opens the door -- a shapely stilettoed leg steps out. It’s RACHEL in a glittering gown. Her hair is swept up, her jewelry catches the light, she’s a VISION. It’s an EXPLOSION OF FLASHES as photographers, reporters, and looky-loos take pictures, yell to get her attention. Rachel is a little overwhelmed, but Oliver helps navigate her through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: NEENAH
dialogues.text: Just right here! Just right here!

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPHER
dialogues.text: Beautiful dress. Thank you. Thanks for the... Excuse me. Excuse me, can I get a picture of you? Lovely. Oh, fantastic. Looking gorgeous. Little closer together. Who's this one? What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: Ma’am.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: (mouthing) You look wonderful. Breathe. (to paparazzi) Everyone, I've got Rachel Chu of New York. Rachel Chu of New York. Real estate heiress, Rachel Chu of the New York Chus.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE SPECTATOR
dialogues.text: Rachel! Rachel! Over here!

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPHER
dialogues.text: Rachel, this way. Rachel! Rachel! To me!

dialogues.speaker: MALE PHOTOGRAPHER
dialogues.text: Okay, ladies, looking good. Looking good. Okay, out of the way, please. Out of the way. Amanda, Celine, and Francesca, look agape, incredulous. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KITTY
dialogues.text: So gorgeous!

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Thank you. A Photographer gestures for Celine to get out of the way so he can take Rachel’s picture. OFF Celine, pissed.

dialogues.speaker: MALE PHOTOGRAPHER
dialogues.text: Ladies, move please. Out of the way! Good, good. That's great. Beautiful dress.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Ladies. Amanda.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: Hmm.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You're in my way.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: Okay, what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Astrid and Michael, dressed for the wedding, sit in the back of a chauffeured Bentley. Michael chatters on as Astrid listens in silence.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: -- Our Chinese investors are getting nervous. I have to fly to Shenzhen on Monday to try and talk them down. This gets Astrid’s attention.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: That’s Cassian’s birthday.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know. I hate to miss it, but this is important.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: You'd think your son’s birthday is important. Get someone else to handle it... (can’t help herself) Unless... there’s another reason you're out of town. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: What are you saying? Astrid presses a button on the console, RAISING THE PARTITION between them and the driver.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: I know you’re having an affair. Michael reacts, uncomfortable, but he doesn’t deny it.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus, Astrid.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: Let’s just get through the wedding and we'll deal with it after. I don’t want to make a scene. Michael looks at her, incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: You find out I’m having an affair with another woman, and you're worried about making a scene?

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: You'd rather I scream and carry on?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Yes. Honestly, I wish you would. It would show you cared about more than what people thought of you and your family --

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: Don’t try and turn this on me. I’m not the one who screwed up!

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Of course not. You’re always the prettiest, richest, most perfect girl in the room. While I’m just this lucky bastard who will never measure up.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: Don’t say that --

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: I know what you’re thinking, Astrid. That’s why you hide your shoes, the jewelry you buy. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: As if every minute of my life I’m not reminded of it. I’m just tired. I’m tired of having nothing I do matter, including having the affair --

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: Of course, what you do matters. How can you say that? As the driver pulls over, Astrid reacts, thrown. Michael gets out of the car. Just like that, he’s gone. Shell-shocked, Astrid starts to break down... then quickly pulls herself together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The interior of the church has been transformed into an ARTFUL ABSTRACT FOREST. Eleanor, Jacqueline, Alix, and Felicity hold court with other SOCIETY WIVES by the front pews. Eleanor looks at the trees, disapproving.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Is this a church or a paddy field?

dialogues.speaker: ALIX
dialogues.text: They spent 40 million on the wedding.

dialogues.speaker: FELICITY
dialogues.text: Really? That’s too much, we’re Methodists. 20 million is our limit.

dialogues.speaker: ALIX
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: JACQUELINE
dialogues.text: Princess Intan! They turn to see PRINCESS INTAN, 40s, a lofty Southeast Asian royal, and her entourage passing by. The Aunties smile but Princess Intan ignores them.

dialogues.speaker: JACQUELINE
dialogues.text: Vicious woman. I heard she demanded a whole row to herself, so she wouldn't be bothered by anyone. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FELICITY
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: JACQUELINE
dialogues.text: Mm-hmm.

dialogues.speaker: FELICITY
dialogues.text: (looking off at someone ) Who is that? Oliver is in the b.g. greeting one of the female guests.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Lovely as always. You made it! All the Aunties turn to see Rachel, walking down the aisle. She’s confident, luminous, turning heads as she walks by. The Aunties look stunned as Rachel reaches their pew.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Aunties.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Rachel, how lovely to see you.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: The pleasure is all mine.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: I'm sorry our row is full. Rachel smiles, placid.

dialogues.speaker: ALIX
dialogues.text: (whispering; re: dress) I love it.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (chuckles) Bak-bak. Okay. Rachel looks for an empty seat, sees one by Princess Intan, and heads over. Jacqueline and Eleanor see this and exchange glances, looking forward to seeing Rachel being taken down a peg. Rachel approaches the Princess.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Princess Intan? Rachel Chu. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Princess Intan ignores her, Rachel presses on.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I read your great article about microloans in the Asian Economics Journal --

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR AND FELICITY
dialogues.text: watching, incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCESS INTAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I received so much criticism about that article.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Well, you know what? I think your critics missed the point. 'Cause your microloans helped women, and women lift up economies. The Princess is surprised. The Princess looks at Rachel, reassessing her.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCESS INTAN
dialogues.text: What is your name again?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Rachel Chu.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCESS INTAN
dialogues.text: It's a pleasure to meet you. Now, what brings you here. All the Aunties look disappointed that Rachel has been accepted by the Princess.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I followed a boy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN EXCITED BUZZ ripples through the crowd. Heads turn to see Astrid, statuesque, gorgeous, enter with AH MA, ina beautiful stately gown, her two Thai servants following behind. Eleanor and the Aunties react, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: FELICITY
dialogues.text: Ah Ma’s here? She never comes to these things!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Astrid and Ah Ma walk down the aisle. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: (in Mandarin; subtitled) Xiexie ni, Ah Ma. [Thank you, Grandma. ]

dialogues.speaker: AH MA
dialogues.text: (in Mandarin; subtitled) Yijia ren bu yong shuo xie, a. [Family never says thank you. ] Astrid leads Ah Ma to a seat.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: (whispering) Sit down.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: (whispering) It’s lovely to see you here.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BACK ALCOVE
dialogues.text: Nick, Colin, and other GROOMSMEN wait. Colin is peeking out at the audience as Nick walks up to him.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: How are you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Ah, good.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: All right. Don't be nervous.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: I'm not nervous.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: You look great.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Thank you. Hey, uh, Rachel's not sitting with your family.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Yeah, I don’t blame her. Mother hasn’t exactly been the most welcoming. But I’m sure she’ll be at the back somewhere laying low. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: (whispering) No. She’s right at the front. Take a look. Nick turns to where Colin is looking and sees:

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL AND THE PRINCESS --
dialogues.text: Rachel looks GORGEOUS, AT EASE, as she chats happily with the Princess.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: (surprised; smiles) I think you’ve got a fighter. Nick is thrilled -- he beams with pride. A GROOMSMAN walks up.

dialogues.speaker: GROOMSMAN
dialogues.text: Guys, it’s time.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Okay. All right.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: Make sure she doesn't take your balls. As Bernard hits Colin in the gut. Colin hunches over and groans.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: Just checking. Just checking.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: (winces and groans) Thanks for dressing up, Bernard.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: Hey. It's not about me.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Yeah. Come on. Thanks, Bernard. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: It's not about me.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: All right. The crowd HUSHES as Colin, Nick, and four GROOMSMEN enter with the PASTOR. They’re a dashing pack. Rachel looks at Nick, her heart swelling with pride. Nick finds her gaze, they lock eyes. When a HUSH falls over the crowd. Eyes turn to: KINA GRANNIS, who takes the stage. She starts singing a hauntingly beautiful rendition of “I Can’t Help Falling In Love.” The MUSIC SOARS as we go into a --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- TWO ADORABLE FLOWER GIRLS (6) enter, scattering petals. -- An equally adorable RING BEARER boy (5) toddles in, clutching his ring pillow. -- The congregation, Nick, and Rachel react to the adorable kids. -- Alistair and Kitty are in the audience smooching. -- As the children reach the altar, Nick takes the ring/pillow from the little boy and does a high-five with him. -- As KINA sings with two 12-YEAR-OLD CHINESE VIOLINISTS AND A BASS PLAYER accompanying her:

dialogues.speaker: KINA
dialogues.text: Like a river flows... -- the AISLE OPENS UP and WATER FLOWS DOWN IT. -- The congregations gasps, amazed. Rachel and Nick stare at each other lovingly. THE MUSIC STOPS. The LIGHTS DIM, everyone in the audience are holding delicate lights on long stems. They all stand and look to the back: -- Where a group of BRIDESMAIDS hold large fronds, forming a SCREEN. They part, REVEALING: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: -- Araminta, who’s luminous, a wedding fantasy come to life. She stands next to her father, holds his arm. -- Araminta steps out of her shoes. The MUSIC swells back up as she steps onto the watery aisle. -- Araminta walks down the aisle with her bridesmaids following, as the audience all wave the GLITTERY LIGHTS towards her. -- Nick looks to Rachel, mouths, “I love you.” Rachel catches her breath, mouths back, “I love you, too,” tears rolling down her cheeks. -- Araminta and Colin face each other as the pastor officiates. Amid all the pageantry, it’s still just a man and a woman, about to be joined together for life. -- All eyes are on Colin and Araminta... except for Eleanor, who watches Nick and Rachel with growing concern. -- Colin lifts Araminta’s veil, they kiss, and everyone claps and cheers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The botanical gardens have been transformed into a magical reception site. The supertrees tower overhead as a CHINESE BIG BAND plays. Fireworks POP, POP, POP overhead. Colin and Araminta are having their first dance, loosely circled by their wedding party, including Nick and Rachel, who are doing everything they can to keep their hands off each other. As they watch Colin and Araminta:

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: You look spectacular, you know that?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: It's the double Spanx. I can't breathe.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: It’s not the clothes. It’s just... you. Rachel smiles. Nick leans in to kiss her when Araminta calls to the group: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: IN ANOTHER
dialogues.text: -- Eleanor SQUEAL and 115.

dialogues.speaker: ARAMINTA
dialogues.text: Uh, excuse me. This party isn't gonna dance itself. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Come on, Nicki-Nick.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: ARAMINTA
dialogues.text: Yeah! Whoo!

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Okay. You're very good.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Yeah? I only stepped on her twice.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Very good.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: (to Felicity) I mean, obviously...

dialogues.speaker: FELICITY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: ALISTAIR
dialogues.text: Yeah! Whoo!

dialogues.speaker: AREA
dialogues.text: sees Nick and Rachel dancing. She hears a turns to see KITTY PONG twerking on Alistair, who has a silly grin on his face. Eleanor reacts with distaste. She’s in no mood for this. Eleanor turns to Oliver, gestures to Kitty and Alistair.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Oliver.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Yes, Aunty?

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Be a dear and take care of that.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: As you wish. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Eleanor leaves. Oliver doesn’t love being ordered about, but does as he’s told.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We FIND Nick and Rachel on the dance floor, completely into each other and having fun.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You know, you should wear a tux more often.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Like all the time?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Hmm, yeah. You know, when you're playing basketball at the Y, shaving, brushing your teeth -- He pulls her in, close. She looks into his eyes... and they kiss.

dialogues.speaker: ON KITTY AND ALISTAIR
dialogues.text: as Oliver walks up.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Alistair, your father’s looking for you. Something about an overdrawn discretionary account. Alistair’s face falls and he takes off. Oliver holds his hand out to Kitty, who takes it. As Oliver leads her in a dance, handling her expertly:

dialogues.speaker: ALISTAIR
dialogues.text: Oh, my God.

dialogues.speaker: KITTY
dialogues.text: Baby! Oh, my gosh! Ah! Hey.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: So...

dialogues.speaker: KITTY
dialogues.text: Hmm?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: How do you like the wedding? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KITTY
dialogues.text: Oh, my gosh! It's so glamorous! When it's Alistair's and my wedding, I want it just like this.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Hmm.

dialogues.speaker: KITTY
dialogues.text: No, no! I want it big! Big! Better!

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: (laughs) Sweetie! You’ll be lucky if Alistair’s parents give you a tea ceremony.

dialogues.speaker: KITTY
dialogues.text: Ooh -- Kitty looks at Oliver, confused.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: You know, Alistair's only the fourth son of a penny-pinching family, don't you? I mean, he'll get next to nothing. You want a wedding like this? You should've fallen in love with an only child. Someone like... Bernard Tai. Oliver twirls her around and dips her to see Bernard surrounded by women and drinking from a champagne bottle.

dialogues.speaker: ON NICK AND RACHEL
dialogues.text: Nick and Rachel pull apart to see one of Ah Ma’s THAI SERVANTS. She speaks with a gentle Thai accent:

dialogues.speaker: THAI SERVANT
dialogues.text: Master Nicholas... your grandmother would like to speak to you and Miss Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Come on.  118.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: Sick party.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Yeah! As Kitty approaches Bernard to dance with him, he hands a champagne bottle to a girl.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: Hold that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Thai Servant takes Rachel and Nick to a private area where Ah Ma and Eleanor are seated at a table.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Ah Ma. Mum. What's all this about? Ah Ma turns to Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: AH MA
dialogues.text: (in Mandarin; subtitled) Rachel... suiran wo renshi ni de rizi bu chang, ke wo kan de chulai, ni shi ge congming ren. [Rachel. I’ve only known you a short time, but it’s clear you're a very smart woman. ] Nick smiles at Ah Ma’s seeming endorsement of Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: AH MA
dialogues.text: (in Mandarin; subtitled) Ke wo buneng rang ni hui le wo de sunzi gen wo de jia. [But, I will not permit you to ruin my grandson with your ambition. ] Rachel is stunned. Nick, reacts, shocked.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Ah Ma!

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: I’m sorry to tell you, but Rachel has been lying to us about her family and her mother... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (guard up) What, uh... What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: I hired a private investigator to look into her past --

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Mum, you didn’t --

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: She said her father passed away in China, but that’s not true. (to Rachel) Your mother’s husband is very much alive. During her marriage she cheated on him and became pregnant with another man’s child, and before he found out she ran away to America. Rachel is gutted, doesn’t know what to think. Eleanor opens a DOSSIER on the table. Chinese news articles and police missing person reports featuring Kerry's picture.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: It’s all in here.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: You had no right --

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: We had every right.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Stop -- You’re lying.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: You did not!

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Do you have any idea the scandal this would have caused? For Rachel to hide something like this --

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: She wouldn’t have. Eleanor sees Rachel is clearly shocked. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: We cannot be linked to this sort of family. Rachel looks at Eleanor, backs away, reeling.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I_don’t want any part of your family. He reaches for her, but Rachel pulls away, stung.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Rachel -- Rachel takes off, Nick starts after her, when:

dialogues.speaker: AH MA
dialogues.text: (in Mandarin; subtitled) Buxu zhui ta. Zaojin ni ziji. Buxu dong. Ni yao gen ta zou, jiu bie huilai! [Don’t chase after her and degrade yourself. I forbid it. If you go with her, you can’t come back! ]

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Let me go! Rachel. Nick pulls away and runs after Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Ah Ma! Nick!

dialogues.speaker: AH MA
dialogues.text: (in Mandarin; subtitled; turns on Eleanor) Dou shi wei le ni, dou shi ni ya rang ta zai waitou dai name jiu. Ni kan jintian! [This is your fault. You let this happen by allowing him to stay away so long. Now, look! ] Eleanor stands there, submissive. Ah Ma reacts, stunned, furious. OFF Eleanor, her worst fears coming true...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel is upset, disoriented, as she makes her way through the crowd. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Hey, Cinderella. What's wrong? You gotta return your dress before midnight?

dialogues.speaker: ARAMINTA
dialogues.text: Why? It's all non-fat.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Nicki-Nick!

dialogues.speaker: ARAMINTA
dialogues.text: Oh, you’re just in time.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Nick, want some cake? Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE WEDDING GUEST
dialogues.text: Come back here! Come back here!

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE WEDDING GUEST
dialogues.text: Drink girl! Drink! She hears a SCREAM and turns to see several guests POINTING and LAUGHING at: A HALF-NAKED Bernard and Kitty behind some bushes. Bernard is completely drunk and paws at Kitty, who’s mortified at being discovered. The crowd LAUGHS, derisive, as Kitty struggles to pull her dress up as she flees. It's sickening to Rachel -- it feels like people are talking about her as much as Kitty. She flees... Among the crowd, we FIND Nick searching for Rachel, but he’s too late...

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Oliver.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Oh, Nicki have you...?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (interrupts) Rachel. Have you seen Rachel?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: I don't -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: Nicholas! How are you? It's been so long.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Oh, Amanda. Yes. Thank you, Amanda. Thank you, Amanda. No, Amanda. Not now.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: It's good to see you. Let's talk. For old times' sake. Nick frantically looks around the party for Rachel. TIME LAPSE as the crowd clears and it starts to rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PAIR OF BARE FEET walks up to the gate. RACHEL, her once-flawless hair, makeup, and dress are a mess. She carries her HIGH HEELS IN HER HANDS. Peik Lin rushes to Rachel, who bursts into tears and collapses into her friend. INT. GOH HOUSE - PEIK LIN’S ROOM - DAY Rachel lies on the upholstered bench at the end of the bed, unmoving, staring into space. Sparse sunlight filters into the room. Peik Lin enters.

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: Rachel? Come to breakfast. You need to eat. Or, use the bathroom, or maybe a shower. It's there if you need it. But Rachel doesn’t move.

dialogues.speaker: TIME LAPSE SEQUENCE
dialogues.text: -- It’s NIGHT: Rachel still lies in bed, awake, but not moving. The door opens. It’s Neenah and Wye Mun with a dinner tray. They have the twin girls bring the tray to Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: WYE MUN
dialogues.text: (whispering) Here, take this tray, okay. Take this to Rachel. Okay, go to her. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GOH TWIN GIRL
dialogues.text: Here, Rachel, this is your dinner.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Thank you. The girls run back to Neenah and Wye Mun and they all leave Rachel who’s just staring at the dinner tray. -- Darkness gives way to dawn, but Rachel is still in bed, unmoving. On the bedside table, her PHONE RINGS. It's NICK, Rachel presses ignore and places the phone face-down on the table. Nick leaves a message --

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (pre-lap) I‘ll stop by again tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick is on the phone, leaving Rachel a message.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (then) Rachel, please, just give me a call. Anytime. Please. Nick hangs up. INT. GOH FAMILY HOUSE - PEIK LIN’S ROOM - DAY Peik Lin enters the dark room.

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: Rachel, someone’s here to see ya. Rachel doesn’t move.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I don’t want to see him.

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: It’s not Nick. Someone steps in from behind Peik Lin. It’s KERRY. Rachel stirs, can’t believe her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Mom! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rachel rushes to her mom, hugging her. Rachel tears up, finally with the person she needed the most.

dialogues.speaker: TIME CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. GOH FAMILY HOUSE - PEIK LIN’S ROOM - DAY The blinds are open and Rachel sits up, looking better, as Kerry fusses over her, bringing her herbal soup.

dialogues.speaker: KERRY
dialogues.text: Drink more. The dong-quai and the ginseng will give you more energy.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
