dialogues.text: Thanks. Rachel lets herself be mothered, but Kerry sees the toll the last few days have taken.

dialogues.speaker: KERRY
dialogues.text: Your spirit has always been so strong, ever since young. You will get through this. Rachel nods, needing to hear that. But:

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Why didn’t you tell me about my father? Kerry nods, she’s been expecting this.

dialogues.speaker: KERRY
dialogues.text: My husband wasn’t a good man. He hurt me. (off Rachel) But an old schoolmate of mine helped me through things and we fell in love and I got pregnant with his baby, that’s you. I was so afraid my husband would find out and kill us both, so I just took you and I ran to America. Rachel is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Did you ever...? I don't know, think about trying to talk to him? I mean, do you think about him? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KERRY
dialogues.text: Every day. When we first came to America all I could think about was reaching out for him, but I was so afraid my husband would find us. And now, I, I just don't want to cause any trouble.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I’m really sorry. Kerry shakes her head, smiles through the tears.

dialogues.speaker: KERRY
dialogues.text: Oh! Don’t be sorry. You listen to me, everything that happened in my past life is the reason why I got you. Rachel tears up, vulnerable.

dialogues.speaker: KERRY
dialogues.text: My brave and clever girl. Rachel flops back on the bed. Her mother lies down next to her.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I really thought he was the one. OFF Rachel as this sinks in.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Now, I just wanna go home.

dialogues.speaker: KERRY
dialogues.text: You know, Nick was the one who called me and brought me out here. Before we go, I think you should go and talk to him. Rachel sighs. Then they hear a clicking sound and turn to see P.T. at the doorway holding his phone and taking photos of them. P.T. I'll e-mail the photo later.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: P.T., how long you been standing there? P.T. Just a short while. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rachel and Kerry laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel sits on a bench, when she sees Nick approach, tentative, hopeful. He sits next to her.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry about everything. What my mother did to you is unforgivable --

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: It’s not your fault --

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: It is. Ever since I can remember, my family has been my whole life. And I am done making excuses for them. He pulls out the ring he’s been carrying. Rachel looks at Nick, astounded.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Nick --

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Marry me. Marry me and we’1ll start our new life together in New York, just you and me. I’11 leave all of this behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eleanor, wearing sunglasses, walks by the row of old terraced shophouses, pausing when she hears a familiar CLACKING sound. She walks through an unmarked door, into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eleanor enters to see Rachel playing mahjong with two WOMEN at a back table. It's a FLUID, RHYTHMIC RITUAL -- the staccato clacking of tiles, stacks being formed and moved like clockwork. Eleanor is surprised to see how adept and effortless Rachel is. Eleanor walks up to the table. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Thanks for meeting me here. (re: women) Don’t worry about them. They’re half deaf and they only speak Hokkien.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: (hands Eleanor dice) Mm-hmm. Eleanor sits down at the table, and tosses the dice in the middle of the stacks of tiles. She starts playing the game.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: My mom taught me how to play. She told me mahjong would teach me important life skills. Negotiation, strategy, cooperation. (NOTE: The game goes on throughout the scene. With cards thrown, picked up, chips exchanging hands, etc.)

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: You asked me here. I assume it’s not for a mahjong lesson. Pung. She puts down a power card combo. The women toss red chips to her.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: My mother taught me, too. Rachel tosses her a red chip.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I know Nick told you the truth about my mom. But you didn’t like me the second I got here. Why is that?

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: There's a Hokkien phrase. Ka gi lan. It means ‘our own kind of people.’ And you’re not our own kind.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: ‘Cause I’m not rich? ‘Cause I didn’t go to a British boarding school or I wasn't born into a wealthy family? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: You're a foreigner. American. And all Americans think about is their own happiness.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Don’t you want Nick to be happy?

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: It’s an illusion. We understand how to build things that last. Something you know nothing about.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You don’t know me.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: I know you’re not what Nick needs.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Well, he proposed to me yesterday. (off Eleanor) He said he'd walk away from his family and from you, for good. Eleanor’s hand slips, she drops a tile. The other women exchange looks, sensing the tension:

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, I turned him down. Eleanor tries to regain her composure.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Only a fool folds a winning hand.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: There’s no winning. You made sure of that. Because if Nick chose me, he would lose his family. And if he chose his family, he might spend the rest of his life resenting you. Eleanor grabs a tile that Rachel had just discarded.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: (realizing) So you chose for him.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I’m not leaving ‘cause I’m scared or because I think I’m not enough. Because... maybe for the first time in my life, I know I am. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (beat) I just love Nick so much. I don't want him to lose his mom again. So I just wanted you to know that one day, when he marries another lucky girl, who is enough for you, and you're playing with your grandkids while the tan huas are blooming, and the birds are chirping, that it was because of me... a poor, raised by a single mother, low class, immigrant nobody. Rachel SHOWS HER HAND -- a WINNING COMBINATION -- but she FOLDS. The game is mucked (no one can win). Rachel gets up. As Rachel reaches the door, REVEAL Kerry has been sitting quietly at another table. As Kerry joins Rachel, she turns to see Eleanor and the two mothers exchange a look. INT. ASTRID’S APARTMENT - BEDROOM - DAY Astrid enters as Michael packs a bag. Michael is uncomfortable, not wanting to do this in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Hey. I'm gonna send someone for the rest of my stuff. But I wanna talk to you about my visitation rights with Cassian.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: Stop talking.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: Don’t worry about packing your things. You bought this apartment, you keep it. We're leaving --

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: What do you mean, you're leaving? Where are you gonna go?

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: I have fourteen apartment buildings that I own, so probably one of those. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And you'll see Cassian when it’s good for him, not when it’s good for you. Astrid walks away. Michael takes her arm, holds her back.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Hey! Look, you know, it's not just my fault that things didn't work out. Astrid pauses, then:

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: You're right. I shouldn’t have kept things from you. Hidden my shoes, turned down jobs, charity work, worrying that it might make you feel lesser than. But let’s be clear -- the problem with our marriage isn’t my family’s money. It’s that you’re a coward. You gave up on us. But I’ve just realized -- (then) It’s not my job to make you feel like a man. I can’t make you something you’re not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peik Lin helps Rachel load SUITCASES into a waiting TAXI.

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: Good for you. Walking away from Nick and his family's fat-ass property portfolio. You have no one, no net worth, but you have integrity. That's why I respect you.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (hugging Peik Lin) Thank you for everything.

dialogues.speaker: NICK --
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: when he hears a KNOCK. He rushes to the door, hopeful, opens it to see:

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: OFF Nick, disappointed, conflicted at seeing his mother.

dialogues.speaker: TIME CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ASTRID’S APARTMENT - BATHROOM - DAY Astrid reaches above the mirror for the box containing the earrings she hid there. She puts them on and looks at her reflection -- she likes what she sees. Emboldened, she exits to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kerry hurries up, dressed for travel, carrying two TUPPERWARE MEALS.

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: (hugging Kerry) Bye, Mrs. Chu!

dialogues.speaker: KERRY
dialogues.text: Goodbye and thank you. As Kerry gets into the taxi:

dialogues.speaker: PEIK LIN
dialogues.text: (to Rachel) Sure I can’t get you to stay? You know, my brother P.T. he’s still single... They turn to see P.T. at the doorway making a hand heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and his mother stand on the balcony of Nick’s room, silent, staring at nothing. Eleanor finally looks at her son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel and Peik Lin hug goodbye. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (to Peik Lin) All right. Rachel gets in the taxi. Peik Lin runs and stands next to her brother, wraps her arm around his shoulders. He puts his hand on her shoulder as the taxi drives away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Rachel’s taxi speeding down the highway heading for the airport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Planes taxi in marked “Pacific Asean Airlines.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel and Kerry make their way down the crowded aisle. They're jostled by other passengers and their carry-on bags. A far cry from first class.

dialogues.speaker: TIME CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ASTRID’S APARTMENT - DAY Astrid walks away while Michael watches.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Rachel! Rachel! Stay there.

dialogues.speaker: KERRY
dialogues.text: I’m gonna go and look for some extra blankets.

dialogues.speaker: CHUBBY WOMAN
dialogues.text: Hello. (in Mandarin) Kuai dian, kuai dian. [Hurry, hurry. ]

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Sorry, just one second. Nick, what are you doing here? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I'm flying back to New York with you.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: God, don’t make this harder than it already is --

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I always imagined what me proposing to you would be like. And you know what, I had it all planned out. (to sitting man on plane) Oh, yeah, right behind you. Don't mind me. (to Rachel) I'd bring you to my favorite spot on the island. There's a hidden trail that I used to go to as a child. Now there's a cove there that opens up to this beautiful lake. (to standing man on plane) Um, sorry, dude. Give me a second. Let me just move. Nick passes by the standing man as he continues:

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: When the sun hits the horizon, I'd get down on one knee. Rachel sighs.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: And the rest of the world would fall away. Because it would just be you and -- Because it's just you and -- (to female passenger struggling with carry-on) Sorry, I can help you with that. That's fine. (to Rachel) Stay there. Thump. Now, Nick is JOSTLED by a WOMAN trying to jam her carry-on in the overhead compartment. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (to woman on plane) Yay. You, too? Watch your fingers. Lift it up. Okay. Nick steps into the aisle, helps the Woman and others get their luggage put away.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (to surrounding passengers) Everybody okay? Because I just need thirty seconds with this woman. Okay, thank you. Nick turns back to Rachel... and gets down on one knee. Rachel is astounded, tries to stay strong.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Oh, coming through. Sorry. I know this is a far throw from a hidden paradise... Rachel looks into his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: But wherever you are in the world, that’s where I belong. She takes this in. He pulls out a ring box.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: But, I -- Nick opens the box, revealing: ELEANOR’S EMERALD RING. Time stops. Rachel’s breath parts from her for the moment. Her eyes meet his and then --

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Rachel Chu. Will you marry me and make me the happiest man in this world? Rachel, teary-eyed and overwhelmed, is about to respond.

dialogues.speaker: CHUBBY WOMAN
dialogues.text: Yes! Yes! Yes! She will marry you! Nick looks at Rachel, “Is Chubby Woman right?” Rachel hands her neck pillow to Chubby woman. Kerry is standing behind her, all smiles. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Yes!! The cabin ERUPTS in HOOTS and CLAPPING! Nick puts the ring on her finger -- a perfect fit. He pulls her into his arms as he kisses her. Chubby Woman high-fives Kerry. Rachel grins as she’s inches away from Nick.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I love you, too. This is gonna be some flight back to New York.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Well, I was actually thinking about staying one more night OFF Rachel, intrigued, in love, excited. She kisses him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick leads Rachel into the middle of a crowd of people with his hands covering her eyes. When he removes his hands, she sees a crowd of Nick’s friends screaming and cheering. Araminta and Colin in front leading the pack. It's an ENGAGEMENT PARTY at this mind-blowing location, perched high above the city. Everyone has shown up: Peik Lin, Eddie, Fiona, Alistair, Bernard, Kitty, Oliver, Colin, Araminta, Charlie, and THE GOHs. They all cheer and hug Rachel and Nick. Nick points for Rachel to look at the pool where SYNCHRONIZED SWIMMERS are performing. Rachel spots Eleanor in the distance. There’s a look of understanding, respect between them. Nick kisses Rachel as all the revelers clap and scream their congratulations. We PULL AWAY as fireworks explode in the b.g... FADE TO BLACK.  136.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Astrid and a handsome man at the party look at each other, then turn away. Then they look back at each other with a sly grin.
